did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Records, 1951-1995, include correspondence, publications, financial records, publicity, program information, photographs, clippings, and video taped interviews (1998-1999).

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford Staffers Records (SC0548). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Stanford Staffers began in 1951 as the Distaff Club, a group of women staff members who gathered for lunch and companionship. Faculty wives served as sponsors, hosting teas and luncheons at their campus homes. Ann Sterling, wife of the late President J.E. Wallace Sterling, was the founding faculty wife-sponsor.

In 1978, the group agreed to admit men and changed its name to Stanford Staffers. Organization goals include providing career support and sharing resources, networking, doing community service, developing and cultivating a diverse workplace and enjoying social contacts. Its activities range from monthly lectures on subjects as diverse as public service and tax planning to an "attitude adjustment hour," held every other month at a restaurant lounge after work.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Records, 1951-1995, include correspondence, publications, financial records, publicity, program information, photographs, clippings, and video taped interviews (1998-1999).

did.unittitle: 4 audio tapes: Irma Jean's Recollections 1991; 3 music tapes
Article clippings, correspondence, and records 1972-1973 (1 of 2)
Article clippings, notes, and correspondence 1951-1987 (1 of 3)
Article clippings, notes, and correspondence 1951-1987 (2 of 3)
Article clippings, notes, and correspondence 1951-1987 (3 of 3)
Article clippings, notes, records, correspondence 1975-1977 (1 of 2)
Article clippings, notes, records, correspondence 1975-1977 (2 of 2)
Bank of the West check book 1984-1986 (empty)
Flyers & publications (folder labeled iOne Of Eachi) 1990-1991
Memento/photo album (black leather with gold leaf) 1951-1968
Miscellaneous papers related to Staffers' 40th Anniversary celebration 1991
Notes: chronology of major events in Stanford Staffers! history 1991
Spring Lecture - correspondence regarding event dates
Stamped letter addressed to Distaff Club 1976
Stanford Staffers Treasurer' s Report 1989-1992 (thick orange
Stanford University Campus Report April 24, 1991 (3 copies)

note.p: The following interview questions were asked:

list.item: Why they were interested and involved in Staffers.
What kinds of organization and activities Staffers had during the interviewee's most active years.
How they thought Staffers contributed to the well-being of Stanford employees.
Their own experience and career path working at Stanford.

did.unittitle: Interviews by Joyce Kiefer with Irma Jean Crouch, Ann Vellmer, Ethel LaPuyade, 1998, and Kimberly Thompson, 1999
Interview by Joyce Kiefer with J. Truher, 1999
